Articles.Content:
As a total beginner to KSP modding, i'd like to know if there's some kind of list of mods which are no longer in developement including some decent parts for other peoples use.

I'm not looking for something specific i'm just trying to get an idea about this issue.

Maybe i'm going to make some little mod for my personal use, but i don't have the time to spend weeks in creating new parts from scratch with more or less (rather less:)) success. (And i must admit i'm a horrible modeler and even worse in creating textures)

I heard the original "KSP interstellar" -Mod is supposed to be open source? Are there any other similar mods which are no longer developed containing decent parts?

Thanks in advance!

Thanks for the link!

Are there any other known abandoned mods to plunder?

Can someone confim that the original Interstellar is open source?

I don't want to get into any troubles just in case.

I don't want to annoy you guys but i find KSP license policy a bit confusing to put it mildly.
Scattered throughout this thread http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43840 are some really nice public domain parts by zzz.

As a total beginner to KSP modding, i'd like to know if there's some kind of list of mods which are no longer in developement including some decent parts for other peoples use.

I'm not looking for something specific i'm just trying to get an idea about this issue.

Maybe i'm going to make some little mod for my personal use, but i don't have the time to spend weeks in creating new parts from scratch with more or less (rather less:)) success. (And i must admit i'm a horrible modeler and even worse in creating textures)

I heard the original "KSP interstellar" -Mod is supposed to be open source? Are there any other similar mods which are no longer developed containing decent parts?

Thanks in advance!

Any mod that is openly licensed is what your looking for (i.e. Creative Commons, GPL, MIT, etc) If the mod is for personal use you dont need to do much more. Just go mess with the parts and have fun!.

If you do plan on redistributing something youve done, make sure you read the source mods particular license, most will just require attributions and such, just take a look at the license.

Thanks everyone for your kind help!

Much appreciated!

But i can't guarantee that i will ever produce something ingenious like some other people have done.
